intro: Campuloclinium, commonly known as the false mallow, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a central column, and they bloom in clusters. Campuloclinium species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
